intro: Erysimum virescens, commonly known as the green-flowered wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, while the stem is erect and covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow or greenish-yellow, with four petals and a distinctive central gland. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides.
